content.raw:
@dan77062. It's ugly but yes currently we expect the full deploy key to be pasted into the text field. 

I noticed I made a mistake in the wiki. The git url should begin with `git@` not `git://`. I've corrected it. Basically it'll be the same url you use with `git clone`

Can you try building the docker image locally using the deploy key method, e.g.

~~~
# Start the ssh-agent in the background.
eval "$(ssh-agent -s)"
# Add ssh key to agent
ssh-add <key_path>
# Add github to known hosts
ssh-keyscan github.com >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts
docker build -t fcomputer:latest <github_url>
~~~
content.html:
@dan77062. It's ugly but yes currently we expect the full deploy key to be pasted into the text field.

I noticed I made a mistake in the wiki. The git url should begin with git@ not git://. I've corrected it. Basically it'll be the same url you use with git clone

Can you try building the docker image locally using the deploy key method, e.g.

# Start the ssh-agent in the background.
eval "$(ssh-agent -s)"
# Add ssh key to agent
ssh-add <key_path>
# Add github to known hosts
ssh-keyscan github.com >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts
docker build -t fcomputer:latest <github_url>
